org.fridlund.javalabra.game.sprites

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fridlund.javalabra.game.sprites.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    For now the easiest way of rendering images on the screen. Loads one or several images from a sprite sheet and loops through them, at a speed based on the current frames duration.
     

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation(SpriteSheet sheet) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFrame(int x, int y, int duration)
      Adds a new frame to the animation list.
      void cleanUp()
      Deletes the OpenGL binding for the sprite sheet texture.
      void render(float x, float y)
      Renders the animations at the scale of 1.0
      void render(float x, float y, float scale)
      Render by a arbitrary scale.
      void setup()
      Access to the first sub image in the sprite sheet.
      void update(float delta)
      If the animations doesn't have any durations it doesn't do anything.

      • Animation

        public Animation(SpriteSheet sheet)
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Access to the first sub image in the sprite sheet. Starts the timer from zero.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Deletes the OpenGL binding for the sprite sheet texture.

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(int x,
            int y,
            int duration)
        Adds a new frame to the animation list.
        Parameters:
        x - - sub image coordinate
        y - - sub image coordinate
        duration - - milliseconds

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        If the animations doesn't have any durations it doesn't do anything. Otherwise it updates the timer and switches between the animation frames according to the time used.
        Parameters:
        delta -

      • render

        public void render(float x,
          float y)
        Renders the animations at the scale of 1.0
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • render

        public void render(float x,
          float y,
          float scale)
        Render by a arbitrary scale.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        scale -
